uw_output:
A cri du chat patient receives several aspects of care.
First, all medical investigations which are not a direct threat to the infant's life should wait until he or she achieves better intellectual status.
Second, the child's development of motor skills and language must be monitored. In the majority of cases, the child will not be able to walk nor speak. Therefore, it may be helpful to consult a physiotherapist and speech therapist.
Third, an appropriate feeding assessment as well as nutritional care must be considered early on in the child' s life. Indeed, it will have to last and to be adapted for the duration of the child' l ' life. Sometimes, children with a rare genetic syndrome have specific feeding difficulties. prompt: What are the different types of glycogen storage disorders ?
w_output:
A systematic literature review.
Glycogen stored diseases (GSD) are inherited metabolic diseases that can be severe, life threatening, even fatal for the patient if misdiagnosed. Some of these diseases are extremely rare, for which there is atypical or non-existing literature data. More importantly, many reviews on GSD are out of date or incomplete, so they are insufficient to inform clinicians of their diagnostic possibilities. After having analyzed a systematic review of GSD, we have observed that their diagnostic difficulties are due to the difficulty of biological, genetic and histological detection: some of these diseasessuch as type 1A deficiencies are often not discovered during childhood. prompt: What is the outlook for greater trochanteric pain syndrome ?
w_output: Essential to understanding the outlook in treatment of greater trochanateric pain synders is to focus on the pain generator in such pains (1). In the greater trochanicer pain syndrome the pain generator is the greater trocanter-hip joint and more particularly pain associated with the joint capsule and synovium (2). The joint capsule, especially the synovium is extremely pain-provocative and sensitive (3) . The inflamed synovium of the greater trochonater hip joint can be regarded as being part of a muscle spindle complex (3,4). It is well known that in normal or " resting " conditions a muscle is innervated not only from the motor nerve fibres which are responsible for excitation of the muscle to act, but also from the sensory nerve fibers which are responsible to monitor the muscle and report to the CNS about muscle length

A qualitative exploration of perspectives of health and social care professionals on the Personal Health Budgets (PHBs) scheme in a London borough 1



## Aims
The Personal Health Budget (PHB) scheme allows individuals to plan and control a certain amount of funding they use for their care and support needs. With increased devolution of health care and social care budget into Local Government in 2013 in England, PHBs were introduced to replace direct payments made into personal assistance allowance or direct payments to care and support services. Although the principles behind the introduction of PHB programmes in UK were for patients and carers to be more active and in control of their own life decisions than was the previous system (i.e. reablement model), there are studies suggesting the problems around the scheme such as the rushed introduction of PBH scheme across England and a lack of guidance for
uw_output:

uw_output: It is important to note that a small number of people may have neurological events after transient ischemic attack which are not due to stroke, particularly if there is a history of angina, or peripheral vascular disease. The commonest cause in people with known coronary artery disease is cardiac embolism due to thrombus shed from the left atrial appendage. Rarer causes include spontaneous arteriovenous fistula, aneurysm bleeding, ectopic pregnancy, and pulmonary emboli. The clinical presentation is usually severe with abdominal, chest or flank, and/or back pain often with sweating (Stewart-Wallace et al, 1978).
